clinical_study.brief_title: Doctor-Patient Communication in Lung Cancer Care
clinical_study.official_title: Doctor-Patient Communication in Lung Cancer Care

collaborator.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to better understand communication between patients with lung cancer and their doctors. The investigators are also interested in patient's perceptions of the quality of communication with his/her doctor and how these perceptions may impact patient outcomes. The doctor is participating in this study and has given us permission to approach his/her eligible patients for study participation.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: # of patients referred to MSK's Tobacco Treatment Program (TTP)
primary_outcome.description: Systematic coding of clinical encounters and the perceived stigma within the clinical consultation interview along with patient-reported data from the post-consultation questionnaire will be used.

arm_group.description: Following informed consent, the patient will complete the patient questionnaire, either electronically, by phone, or on paper. Patients who prefer to complete the survey electronically will be emailed a link to access to a secure electronic (web-based) version of the study assessment which they will have access to from any computer. We will include an introductory email with the survey link. Will audio-record actual patient-physician clinical consultations with lung cancer patients at Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK). Completing the survey will take about 15 minutes. Answer a few open-ended questions about the consultation with the doctor. We will audio record your answers to these questions. This will take about 15 minutes.
Will have 5 visits/consultations with their patients audio recorded.

intervention.description: patients will fill out a questionnaire about their perceived stigma, satisfaction with communication, and psychological distress.
Then they will participate in a brief in-person interview about their perceived stigma during the clinical consultation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with confirmed lung cancer diagnosis or mass suspicious of lung cancer seen at MSK within past 0-3 months at time of consent as per clinician report and/or EMR
- Lung cancer treatment plan at MSK to include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation and/or immunotherapy within three months of the time of consent
- Participating physician approves his/her patient's participation in this study per physician report.
- Former (at least 100 cigarettes in lifetime and quit more than 30 days prior to enrollment) or current smoker (lifetime smoker who reports cigarette smoking within the past 30 days) as per self report or EMR;
- English fluency (determined through EMR or clinician report), as we do not have the resources to translate the consultations from other languages or the surveys to other languages;
- Patients must 18 years old or older
Physician Inclusion Criteria:
- An MSK attending physician (radiologists, medical oncologists, and surgeons), who is a member of the Thoracic Disease Management Team currently treating thoracic patients at MSK as per self report
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient unable to comply with study procedures as determined by principal investigator.
Physician Exclusion Criteria:
- Inclusion on protocol face-page (e.g., Bernard Park, MD)
